job_description: Data Analyst - job post Mazars USA 513 reviews New York, NY Full-time Mazars USA 513 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Description: Data Analyst Mazars in US is an independent member firm of Mazars Group, an international audit, tax and advisory organization with operations in over 90 countries. With roots going back to 1921 in the US, the firm has significant national presence in strategic geographies, providing seamless access to 26,000+ professionals around the world. Our industry specialists deliver tailored services to a wide range of clients across sectors, including individuals, high-growth emerging companies, privately-owned businesses and large enterprises. Mazars works as a single, integrated team, committed to helping our clients and people succeed by respecting who they are and how they work, adapting our approach accordingly. We take pride in what we do and are committed to playing our part in building the economic foundations of a fair and prosperous world Our Consulting practice seeks a Data Analyst to join our Data Services team. The team is looking for a new team member excited about leveraging technical and communication skills to deliver outstanding results to clients. A promising candidate will have experience with relational databases and common tools used to access and manipulate that data (e.g. SQL and Python). A background in accounting and finance is not required, but a willingness to learn key concepts in those areas will be necessary to succeed in the position. The new team member will work as part of a larger project team and will support project work under the guidance of a dedicated project manager. Prior consulting experience in consulting desirable. This is a remote-work position. Our firm has offered our employees the option to work remotely at this time. Professional Responsibilities: Interact with internal Mazars teams and external clients to gather requirements, execute ongoing projects, and deliver results Ingest, clean, and organize client data. Detect data quality issues, identify root causes, and implement corrective action Conduct data analysis via data discovery, exploration, investigation, and impact assessments Communicate project results clearly and concisely using Excel, PowerPoint, and visualization tools such as PowerBI Develop and own data products, reporting, and services Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree (e.g., Information & Technology Management, Business, Finance, Computer Science) Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to organize, manipulate, and summarize data using modern methods including SQL and Python Effective organization and time management skills Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) and data storytelling Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills Attention to accuracy and detail required Authorized to work in the U.S. What We Offer: Competitive base salary and incentive compensation plan A comprehensive, competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental and life insurance plans, a generous paid days’ off (PDO) plan, and a competitive 401k Plan A dynamic, diverse work experience in a growing global organization An inclusive, client-centered environment where you can develop new skills, enhance your overall business knowledge and work with world-class professionals Intensive customized training, including in-house leadership development programs, continuing professional education courses, and both classroom and on-the-job training Opportunity for International Mobility experiences are also made available Mazars in US is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and maintains a drug-free workplace.

You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $59,500 - $110,500 a year Job Type Full-time Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here. Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of. Who We Are… When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next… From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive. Your New Role… Would you like to work for a leading global media organization? If so, we’d love to hear from you. We are currently recruiting an Analyst within the CNN Digital Research & Analytics team, which will report to the Sr. Manager of CNN Digital Research & Analytics. If you are passionate about digital analytics and audience insights, there's no better job than this! We're looking for an energetic, data-focused Digital Research Analyst to join our team at CNN. The Analyst will be part of a fast-paced team that provides audience and trending insights for the full portfolio of CNN Digital properties. This position will play a key role in analyzing audience engagement and trends, and support audience forecasting. The ideal candidate will have 1-3 years experience with gathering and visualizing data from various sources, and providing insights. You will have a curious mind with enthusiasm for analysis, and the ability to translate data into actionable insights. Your Role Accountabilities… Support key business initiatives by providing daily, weekly, and monthly insights for a better understanding of CNN Digital’s audience, products, and content. Support audience forecasting efforts to help predict future audience traffic and consumption trends. Analyze performance across CNN Digital products, platforms, and business units to inform short-term and long-range projections. Design dashboards and presentations with effective data visualizations, leveraging CNN’s suite of analytics and syndicated tools to make complex performance data actionable. Use syndicated data services such as comScore and SimilarWeb to analyze CNN Digital’s competitive set and emerging digital landscape trends. Collaborate across the business, from sales and finance to editorial and product, to enhance and inform strategies with audience insights. Build automation into existing reports and improve processes to make our audience and forecasting efforts more accurate and efficient. Qualifications & Experience… Bachelor’s degree or higher. Journalism, communications, marketing, data analytics, data science or related field preferred. 1-2 years of experience in digital analytics or related role (internship work will be considered) A genuine interest and knowledge of the media and digital industry landscape Thorough understanding of digital metrics High level of curiosity to explore the “why” behind the data, a passion for all digital experiences, and a commitment to growing and developing as a researcher Thrives on working as part of an enthusiastic and energetic team, and embraces learning new skills and tools to drive thinking further Able to handle analysis of datasets from multiple sources with the ability to craft insights and storylines Attention to detail and accuracy in compiling and analyzing data is a must. Solid time management skills and ability to work on multiple projects Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills required Experience with analytics software like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics) Experience with BI & data analytics tools like Snowflake, Domo, Tableau, Looker Familiarity with syndicated data sources such as comScore, SimilarWeb, Google Search Console, Conviva, Shareablee, Tubular, comScore or similar. Knowledge of SQL or other database query logic is a plus How We Get Things Done… This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview. The Legal Bits… In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. $59,500.00 - $110,500.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO). Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law. If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

Business Analyst - job post Nyc School Bus Umbrella Services Brooklyn, NY 11222 $65,000 - $75,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $65,000 - $75,000 a year Job Type Full-time NYCSBUS (New York City School Bus Umbrella Services Inc.) is a newly formed independent not-for-profit corporation that provides school bus transportation services to New York City public and private school students. NYSCBUSs goal is to radically improve student bus transportation by innovating in all areas and providing unprecedented transparency. A crucial part of this innovation involves bringing modern data practices to the world of school busing. The Business Analyst will be responsible for collecting and integrating data streams from NYCSBUSs systems to develop performance indicators that offer a comprehensive view of the NYCSBUSs operations and organization. This position reports to the CIO and will be closely working with NYCSBUS leadership to develop reports, and key performance indicators. Previous experience in financial, supply chain, logistics, or operations analysis is preferred. This is an opportunity to become part of an innovative team where you will be working with seasoned technologists who will offer incredible learning opportunities and career growth. This is a permanent full-time position available for an immediate start. This is an on-site position working at our Greenpoint bus depot and may require some local travel between boroughs. Salary range is $65,000-75,000 depending on experience. NYCSBUS seeks applicants that reflect the diversity of our mission. Applicants are encouraged to identify their experiences in contributing to an inclusive climate. Women and members of historically underrepresented groups are especially encouraged to apply. **Please note, we are unable to sponsor international workers at this time.** What You'll Do / In collaboration with the CEO and Data team, you will: Become an in-house expert on internal and external NYCSBUS systems. Download data from NYCSBUS systems for preparing daily operational reports Manage complex data projects by partnering with different operational units (Service Delivery, Fleet, Finance, Risk) Create templates in Google Sheets to drive daily operations. Help analyze trends from the data. Develop knowledge of the school bus industry by learning from our subject matter experts. Ideate process improvements for handling data. Key Job Outcomes: Daily / weekly/monthly performance reporting that takes multiple streams of data, produced daily to provide a comprehensive understanding of the companys performance. NYCSBUS managers and staff believe they understand how the company is performing and how they can affect that performance NYCSBUS has visibility over its operations and can track short - medium - and long-term activity and trends NYCSBUS takes advantage of innovative technology What you'll bring / Desired Qualifications: Bachelor's degree, in a relevant field like Library Science or Information Technology OR relevant work experience. Advanced Excel skills (vLookup, Countif, If/Then, Index/Match, Pivot Tables, etc.). A test will be given to evaluate these skills. Experience in database design and structuring Knowledge of financial data systems is preferred but not required. Project Management experience using Jira or similar project management software. Comfortable or can learn to work with Google Sheets A desire to learn how to code in python / do more advanced analytics with our Data science team. Knowledge of SQL a plus Additional skills: Business Intelligence like Tableau, Looker, or Google Data Studio is a plus, You have an analytical mind, with strong investigative skills - you enjoy a good logic puzzle! Communication and collaboration - you are comfortable asking questions, sharing ideas, reaching out when you need help, and jumping in to help others. You understand that all teams are part of a whole. You are proactive - you do what needs to be done, anticipate problems, and think about solutions without waiting for explicit instructions. You are self-motivated, curious, and thrive where you can teach yourself new skills. You pick up on new software and new technologies quickly. You are comfortable and enjoy diving deep into complex and large data sets. And interest in working in a sometimes chaotic, rubber-meets-the-road, not-very-glamorous company, with a very diverse group of colleagues, all very focused on helping families that often need a lot of help get a great education for their children If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $31.54 - $37.84 an hour Job Type Full-time **Please note that this position is fully on-site based in Brooklyn, NY** ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The mission of RiseBoro Community Coalition is to reduce the use of e-cigarettes, alcohol, marijuana, and other substances among youth in New York City. The Coalition plans to accomplish this by building and sustaining a safe and drug-free community where youth feel protected, confident, and empowered to make healthy choices. The goal is to transform the environment around the youth to ensure their mental health needs are supported and that choosing to be drug-free is easy. Under the general supervision of the Director of Clinical Services, the Data Analyst will work closely with Program Directors and direct service staff of the RiseBoro Education Division to support this initiative. The Data Analyst will play a key role in quality improvement efforts by using data gathered to evaluate best practices, assess program operations, and develop metrics for success to increase the quality of service delivery and service impact. The Data Analysts technical expertise will ensure the quality and accuracy of gathered data, then they will process, design, and present the data clearly for decision-making. Specific duties and responsibilities include: Oversee prevention needs assessment, conduct assessments (focus groups/key informant interviews/archival data), data collection (qualitative & quantitative), and outcomes evaluation; including surveys and archival data used to assess changes in consumption, consequence, and risk & protective factors Assess program needs, data collection, and outcomes evaluation including surveys, archival data, focus groups, and key informant interviews used to assess risk and protective factors Create and maintain the Data Map for all programs Develop data collection training guides for staff members at each program site Design and develop data visualizations and dashboards from gathered program data using reporting tools i.e., Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc. Train program staff on data entry requirements and procedures, data collection and the dissemination of surveys, etc. Create and run data validation reports to identify missing or invalid program data Collaborate with program staff to ensure timely and accurate data entry; capture and correct data discrepancies Ensure that all evaluative activities are culturally sensitive and will aim to bridge any age, gender, cultural, racial, or institutional barriers using appropriate communications and methodologies Collaborate with Program Directors to develop surveys, focus group questions, and interview protocols Partner with Program Directors in developing theories of change, logic models, and impact measurement for each program Collect, review, analyze, and store structured and unstructured data received from all programs Create and modify reports to analyze program performance Report program outcomes to stakeholders, as needed Manage program files for review Other related duties as assigned by the Director COMPETENCIES Comprehensive understanding of data system administration, data collection, and monitoring; data analysis and reporting; data development and inquiry support; data visualization skills required Experience working with and supporting inquiries on Real-World Data and/or creating related reports Excellent oral, written, and presentation communication skills: effective for report-writing, data presentation to funders, and staff training virtually and in-person Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet contractual deadlines Ability to think critically, problem solve and use sound judgment Ability to maintain professionalism in stressful situations and sustain full confidentiality Proficient in the evaluation of environmental strategies and measuring the processes and outcomes associated Proficient in Microsoft Office specifically Excel, PowerPoint, or their Google Suite equivalents; the analytical function in Excel required Profound knowledge of Stata, SPSS, SAS, R, Python, and Atlas.ti, NVivo preferred Knowledge of Statistical Analysis i.e., Hypothesis and A/B testing Experience with Unstructured Data Analytics i.e., ability to offer solutions to give structure to unstructured data for it to be properly processed and analyzed preferred Ability to adapt and be flexible with changing priorities Ability and comfort working with diverse populations in various environments Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team Commitment to RiseBoros mission, vision, and values Ability to understand the concepts of institutional and structural racism and bias and their impact on underserved and underrepresented communities Demonstrated commitment/passion for serving youth, and families and/or supporting communities who have experienced systemic oppression and/or bias (i.e., people of color, LGBTQ+ people, immigrants, justice-involved persons, etc.) EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE Bachelors degree in a quantitative field (data analytics, business analytics, data science, statistics, or data management and 1-3 years of related work experience required Masters Degree or self-study/certificates in analytics, data science, digital media/marketing, or equivalent related work experience a plus It is the policy of RiseBoro to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. Whether you are early in your career or an expert in your field, you will find HSS an innovative, supportive and inclusive environment. Working with colleagues who love what they do and are deeply committed to our Mission, you too can be part of our transformation across the enterprise Job description: Biostatistician & Data Science Analyst I The HSS Biostatistics Core provides comprehensive methodologic and analytic support to clinicians and basic scientists at Hospital for Special Surgery, in the area of musculoskeletal research. Under the direction of the Core Director, this analyst will provide study design and statistical analysis support for a variety of projects for the HSS Department of Medicine, a nationally and internationally recognized center for leading-edge musculoskeletal and rheumatologic care and research. This role will contribute to the advancement of research with a multidisciplinary team of clinicians, scientists, engineers, and other statisticians to leverage unique healthcare data (in the form of medical images, clinical data, and beyond) and implementing appropriate study design, evaluation tools, and methods associated with various research projects. Additionally, this position will collaborate and advise faculty on the most appropriate statistical methods to apply to research design and outcomes analysis. The analyst will also be responsible for helping to execute the Department’s Machine Learning strategy with the mission of creating new and improved methods for assessing and predicting disease outcomes and biology at Hospital for Special Surgery. The analyst will have opportunities for authorship on publications stemming from his/her work and will play a key role in producing and sharing the results the broader scientific community. Essential Tasks/Responsibilities: Assist in protocol development by implementing proper study design methodology, performing sample size and power calculations, and generating randomization schedules. Make recommendations for appropriate statistical analyses and design to investigators and study team. Perform statistical queries, analyses, and evaluation as assigned through the Biostatistics Core. Develop robust algorithms and techniques using image analytics and deep learning across a variety of large and diverse medical image datasets for the purpose of developing ML models. Responsible for accuracy and timeliness of summary reports, tables, and figures to investigators and study team. Collaborate on grants, presentations and manuscripts submitted for publication, including writing methods sections and analysis plans for incorporation into protocol and grant submissions. Contribute to teaching biostatistical methodology to medical students, residents, fellows, and other Hospital staff. Stay informed of statistical techniques as applied to musculoskeletal research issues by reading journals and/or attending courses/programming meetings. Collaborate with other members of the Core by suggesting changes or improvements to existing analytic code, study design protocols, and any proposed analytic methods. Education/Experience Master's Degree in related field of epidemiology or biostatistics. 1-2 years required (1-3 years preferred) of biostatistical consulting experience, either within the academic curriculum or as part of a consulting service unit. Background in Machine Learning techniques and practical experience in evaluating the performance of ML algorithms on test and real clinical data. Experience in musculoskeletal research is preferred. Competencies SAS is the preferred statistical package within the HSS Biostatistics Core, but candidates with experience in other statistical packages (R, SPSS, Stata, Python) are encouraged to apply. Intermediate proficiency in data preparation, machine learning and/or data science, descriptive analyses, comparative statistics, and advanced statistical modeling. Possess the ability to facilitate the flow of information through effective written and oral communication. Possess ability to interpret technical medical data and generate sound recommendations to support clinical research efforts. Maintain ability to work independently and take responsibility for timeliness of analytic reports and other deliverables. Demonstrate good organization skills, effective time management, and the ability to manage several concurrent tasks. Maintain a team-oriented approach and possesses the ability to cultivate a positive and collegial workplace relationships – always demonstrating integrity and ethics. Appreciate and understand the connection between individual goals, departmental goals, and the organizational mission – while continually seeking ways to improve personally and as a team.
